column4: I have a wireless home network with laptops that are configured with dhcp on my home router, and I want to computers by name instead of by IP (which changes).  Is ddns the best way to do this?
want to refer to them by name
in relation  to other computers on the network?
or in relation to other comnps on the internet?
you could setup a DNS server
what are the different computers doing between eachother?
various things, such as ssh and unison
but maybe that might be too complicated with  a lot of computers
but I think messing around with the IPs assigned to my computers might require me to ditch my router for an always-up Linux computer to be the server
basically what I'm wondering is, is there any alternative to ddns or static ips?
not it doesn't. Assign on the router static IPS, have each computer setup with the right hostname, and you're fine
actually, if you already have hostnames setup (which you would if you installed Ubuntu the regualr way) then it should already work
hrm. It depends on the router you have to be honest.
have you tried just ssh'ing using the remote computer's nasme?
well I tried ssh'ing using the name that I get on the remote computer when I type "hostname"
ssh is installed, it works if I enter an IP
I don't think my router lets me set static IP's for my home network, it only does dhcp as far as I can see
